pages.sheet_title: CalGreen A/A Checklist — Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 1
pages.description: First sheet of the 2022 California Green Building Standards Code (CalGreen) Residential Mandatory Measures checklist with July 2024 Supplement. Covers Chapter 3 general scope, Chapter 4 divisions 4.1 (Planning and Design), 4.2 (Energy Efficiency), 4.3 (Water Efficiency), 4.4 (Material Conservation), and 4.5 (Environmental Quality). Includes EV charging, water fixture flow rates, waste diversion, and indoor air quality provisions.
key_content: CalGreen mandatory measures: 2022 edition with July 2024 Supplement
Division 4.1: Planning and Design — site development, stormwater management, EV charging provisions (4.106.4)
Division 4.2: Energy Efficiency — mandatory energy efficiency references
Division 4.3: Water Efficiency — kitchen faucets, lavatory faucets, showerheads (GPM limits), water closets max 1.28 GPF, urinals max 0.5 GPF
Division 4.4: Material Conservation — construction waste diversion 65% minimum (4.406.1)
Division 4.5: Environmental Quality — fireplaces (direct vent/sealed combustion), pollutant control, indoor air quality
EV charging: EVSE required for new single family and townhome construction (4.106.4.1)
Stormwater: SWPPP or erosion control plan required for construction (4.106.1)
Grading and paving: stormwater management plan required (4.106.3)
Outdoor water: landscape irrigation per MWELO (4.304.1)
Building maintenance and operation provisions (Section 4.10)
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific GPM flow rates for kitchen faucets, lavatory faucets, and showerheads
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific EV charging amperage and voltage requirements
NOT SHOWN: checkbox completion status not determinable from image quality

drawing_zones.content: Chapter 3 General scope and Section 302 Mixed Occupancy Buildings
Division 4.1 Planning and Design, EV charging (4.106.4), stormwater (4.106.1), grading (4.106.3), definitions and abbreviations table
Division 4.2 Energy Efficiency, Division 4.3 Water Efficiency and Conservation (4.303 indoor water use, 4.304 outdoor water use)
Division 4.4 Material Conservation and Resource Efficiency, Division 4.5 Environmental Quality, Section 4.10 Building Maintenance and Operation
Ideal ADU Design logo and title block
Title block with sheet A1A.1 designation

pages.sheet_title: CalGreen A/A Checklist — Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 2
pages.description: Second sheet of the 2022 CalGreen Residential Mandatory Measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Covers pollutant control with full VOC limit tables for adhesives (Table 4.504.1), sealants (Table 4.504.2), paints (Table 4.504.4), and formaldehyde limits (Table 4.504.5). Also covers indoor air quality and exhaust (4.505), environmental comfort (4.506), resilient plumbing (4.507), interior moisture control, installer qualifications, and verification/documentation requirements (Section 703).
key_content: Adhesive VOC limits (Table 4.504.1): Indoor carpet 50 g/L, wood flooring 100 g/L, drywall/panel 50 g/L, multipurpose construction 70 g/L, contact adhesive 80 g/L, structural wood 140 g/L, PVC welding 510 g/L, ABS welding 325 g/L
Sealant VOC limits (Table 4.504.2): Architectural 250 g/L, non-membrane roof 300 g/L, single-ply roof membrane 450 g/L
Sealant primer VOC limits: Architectural non-porous 250 g/L, architectural porous 775 g/L
Paint VOC limits (Table 4.504.4): Flat coatings 50 g/L, non-flat 100 g/L, non-flat high gloss 150 g/L
Formaldehyde limits (Table 4.504.5): Hardwood plywood veneer core 0.05 ppm, hardwood plywood composite core 0.05 ppm, particleboard 0.09 ppm, MDF 0.11 ppm, thin MDF 0.13 ppm
Indoor air quality: bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated, ducted to exterior (4.505)
Interior moisture control: moisture barrier beneath concrete slabs (4.507.1)
Installer qualifications: HVAC installers shall be trained and qualified (700.1)
Verification and documentation requirements (Section 703)
HVAC duct protection during construction required (4.504.1)
SCAQMD Rule 1168 referenced for adhesive/sealant VOC compliance
NOT SHOWN: checkbox completion status not determinable from image quality
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific exhaust fan CFM requirements
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific moisture content percentage limits for building materials

drawing_zones.content: Pollutant control continuation: moisture content, ROC definitions, HVAC duct protection (4.504.1-4.504.3)
Adhesives/sealants/caulks VOC requirements (4.504.5), Adhesive VOC Limits Table 4.504.1
Sealant VOC Limits Table 4.504.2, Paint VOC Limits Table 4.504.4
Formaldehyde Limits Table 4.504.5
Division 4.5 Environmental Quality continued: indoor air quality (4.505), environmental comfort (4.506), resilient plumbing (4.507), reference URLs
Interior moisture control (4.507), installer and special inspector qualifications (700.1), verifications (703), documentation (703.1)

Title block with sheet A1A.2 designation

pages.description: Structural general notes page covering statement of special inspection, design criteria (seismic and wind), concrete specifications, reinforcement requirements with rebar cover table, and general construction notes. Dense text-based reference sheet.
key_content: Seismic design: Ss = 1.618, S1 = 0.618, SDS = 1.405, Seismic Design Category D, Site Class D
Seismic importance factor: p = 1.3, Occupancy II
Equivalent lateral force procedure, R = 6.5
Basic wind speed: 95 MPH
Floor live load: 40 PSF, Roof live load: 20 PSF
Concrete: 2,500 PSI, W/C ratio 0.65, normal weight, Type V Portland Cement (ASTM C-150)
Non-shrink grout: 7,000 PSI minimum compressive strength at 28 days
Rebar: ASTM A-615 Grade 60, smooth dowels ASTM A-36 (36 KSI)
Rebar cover: footings against earth 3", exposed to weather #6+ = 2", #5 and smaller = 1-1/2", other = 3/4"
Lap splices: Class B unless noted otherwise
Special inspection required: reinforced concrete (CBC 1705.3), wood shearwall (CBC 1705.12), epoxy dowels (CBC 1705.13), soil condition (CBC 1705)
2022 California Building Code governs
All footings: min 12" top of current adjacent grade, min 12" native soil
Backfill compaction: 90% relative compaction minimum
NOT SHOWN: lumber species and grade specification (deferred to SN2)
NOT SHOWN: nailing schedule (deferred to SN2)

drawing_zones.content: Statement of Special Inspection (table + notes) and Design Criteria (seismic + wind)
Concrete specifications (strength table, cement type, aggregates) and Reinforcement requirements (rebar grade, cover table, splices)
General construction notes (15 items covering code compliance, excavation, backfill, utilities)

pages.description: Continuation of structural notes with full nailing schedule table (30+ connection types), mechanical and adhesive anchor specifications (Hilti HIT-HY 200), and structural wood requirements including lumber grades, pressure treatment, galvanization, and engineered wood product specs (Parallam PSL, Microllam LVL).
key_content: Nailing schedule: 30+ connections specified (e.g., joist to sill 3-8d, top plate to stud 2-16d end nail, double top plates 16d @ 16" O.C.)
Top or sole plate to stud: 2-16d end nail
Stud to sole plate: 4-8d toe nail or 2-16d end nail
Double top plates face nail: 16d @ 16" O.C.
Rim joist to top plate: 8d @ 6" O.C.
Built-up corner studs: 16d @ 24" O.C.
Rafter to joist face nail: 3-16d
Adhesive anchors: Hilti HIT-HY 200, ASTM A-32 threaded rods, ASTM A-563 Grade A nuts
Adhesive dowels: ASTM A-615 Grade 60
Anchor proof testing: 10% of all anchors, no sooner than 24 hours after installation
Adhesive anchors: minimum 7-day concrete cure before installation
Lumber: Douglas Fir-Larch (DFL), No. 2 grade (2x6 & under), No. 1 all others
Beams and stringers: Select Structural grade
Posts and timbers: Select Structural (4x4 and larger)
Studs: 2x4 minimum at 16" O.C. max
Pressure-treated: all wood in contact with concrete/masonry, within 6" of earth, sill plates — KDAT per AWPA
Hardware galvanization: minimum G-185 or stainless steel for PT lumber contact (ASTM A153)
Engineered wood: Parallam PSL (Weyerhaeuser, ICC-ESR 1387, LARR 25202)
Engineered wood: Microllam LVL (Weyerhaeuser, Grade 1.55E, ESR 1387, LARR 25202)
Wood moisture content at installation: max 19%
NOT SHOWN: specific sheathing nailing schedule for shearwalls (see shearwall schedule on detail sheet)

drawing_zones.content: Nailing Schedule table (30+ connection types with nail sizes and patterns) and Toe Nail Installation detail
Mechanical and Adhesive Anchors specifications (12 items: Hilti HIT-HY 200, testing, installation requirements)
Structural Wood specifications (lumber grades, pressure treatment, galvanization, engineered wood products, substitution requirements)

pages.description: Structural sheet showing partial foundation plan (left) and partial floor framing plan (right) at 1/2" = 1'-0" scale, with foundation notes (101-107) and framing notes (201-204). Includes symbols legend for shearwall and holdown locations.
key_content: Foundation: 4" slab on grade with #4 rebar at 16" O.C. each way
Continuous footing: 15" wide x 18" deep with 2-#4 bars
Foundation bolts: 5/8" diameter, 7" embedment, 48" max spacing, 12" max to ends
Concrete: 2500 PSI, Type V cement, W/C ratio not to exceed 0.45, no special inspection required
Foundation sill plate: preservative-treated wood
Epoxy dowels to existing concrete: Simpson SET SC (ESR#4057), 8" minimum embedment
Floor framing: 2x6 @ 16" O.C. and 2x8 @ 16" O.C.
Headers: 4x6 HDR with trimmer stud U.N.O.
Wall sheathing at shear walls: 3/4" CD APA rated plywood or OSB, 32/16 span rating, 8d common at 4" O.C. edge / 12" O.C. field
Floor sheathing: 15/32" CD APA rated plywood or OSB, 32/16 span rating, 10d common at 6" O.C. edge / 12" O.C. field
Stud wall framing per detail 8/S3
Fasteners in contact with PT wood: hot dipped zinc-coated, galvanized, stainless steel, silicon, bronze, or copper
NOT SHOWN: vapor barrier notation
NOT SHOWN: shearwall mark numbers on plan (marks referenced to schedule on S2)
NOT SHOWN: holdown mark numbers on plan (holdowns referenced to detail on S2)

pages.description: 2022 Single Family Residential Mandatory Requirements Summary organized as 6 dense text panels (3 columns x 2 rows). Covers building envelope (air leakage, insulation, fenestration, cool roof), mechanical/HVAC (duct insulation/sealing, ventilation, equipment efficiency), water heating, lighting (high-efficacy), solar ready provisions, HERS verification requirements, EV charging readiness, and energy storage readiness.
key_content: 2022 Title 24 Mandatory Requirements Summary — comprehensive reference
Building envelope: air leakage sealing, ceiling/attic insulation, wall insulation, raised floor insulation, slab edge insulation, fenestration certification
Roof deck / cool roof / radiant barrier requirements
Fireplace damper and combustion air requirements
Pipe insulation: hot water pipe insulation per pipe diameter
Duct insulation: minimum R-value for supply and return ducts
Duct sealing: mastic or listed duct tape per SMACNA standards
Mechanical ventilation: ASHRAE 62.2 whole-house and local exhaust requirements
Space conditioning efficiency requirements (HVAC minimum efficiency standards)
Water heater efficiency requirements and pipe insulation
High-efficacy lighting: all permanently installed luminaires
Solar ready zone requirements for new construction
Combustion appliances: sealed combustion / direct-vent requirements
HERS verification items: duct leakage, refrigerant charge, airflow, fan watt draw, QII
PV photovoltaic system sizing requirements for new construction
Battery energy storage readiness provisions
EV charging readiness: dedicated circuit provisions
Demand response capable thermostat requirements
Quality Insulation Installation (QII) verification requirements
Moisture control and vapor barrier requirements

drawing_zones.content: Mandatory requirements: building envelope (air leakage, ceiling/attic, insulation certification, walls, raised floor, slab edge, fenestration, roof deck, below-grade walls, fireplaces)
Mandatory requirements: mechanical/HVAC (pipe insulation, space heating/cooling, duct insulation/sealing, ventilation ASHRAE 62.2, refrigerant piping)
Mandatory requirements: equipment efficiency, water heating, pool/spa, lighting/electrical, appliances
Mandatory requirements: comfort provisions, air conditioning, solar ready, combustion appliances, dwelling ventilation, cooling ventilation, comfort zone/thermostat
Mandatory requirements: HERS verification, installation certificates, QII, fenestration verification, duct testing, electrical distribution, demand response
Mandatory requirements: energy storage readiness, PV photovoltaic requirements, battery storage, EV charging, plumbing, moisture control
